attributes.action: Give weapons to Ukraine to defend herself from Russian hybrid war
attributes.background: The level of Russian aggression is rising just as our once formidable ability (back in the cold war ) to counter them seems to have vanished altogether. Instead, we have trouble simply recognizing them for what they are.
attributes.additional_details: Ukraine gave up its nuclear weapons in exchange for the grantee from the United Kingdom that they will protect the Ukrainian nation from invasion. The Budapest Memorandum on Security Assurances signed in Budapest, Hungary on 5 December 1994, providing security assurances by its signatories relating to Ukraine's accession to the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons. The Memorandum was signed by USA and the United Kingdom..  It is time to honor the spirit of the agreement..

attributes.action: Grant all those who have finished Secondary education the ability to vote.
attributes.background: By the end of secondary education, people have to decide where next to go in there life, whether it be further education, an apprenticeship or full time employment. At this age, people make life changing decisions about there own life. Why shouldn't they have a say in there country's life?
attributes.additional_details:
Year groups at college are split, as some people are too young to vote. Some people who are slightly too young to vote have to deal with other people's decisions until they are, in some cases, 22 years old. 
Some people can go through life with just there secondary education, and still have the ability to vote. So it cannot be argued that, in this case, with only a secondary education, teenagers do not have the mental capability to vote. 
We should allow young people to shape there future.

attributes.action: Allow immigrants to vote in UK national elections and referendums.
attributes.background: The scapegoating of immigrants during political campaigns narrows the debate, hides the true reasons for economic problems, and distorts the result. If immigrants were granted the vote, as they are in local elections, they would not be targeted in this way.
attributes.additional_details: During the 18 September 2014 referendum on Scottish independence, all EU and Commonwealth citizens resident in Scotland aged 16 or over could vote. During the 23rd June 2016 referendum on the UK's membership of the EU, immigrants from the EU were not allowed to vote, though commonwealth citizens were. The campaign focussed unduly on the issue of immigration to the detriment of other important issues.

attributes.action: Make a ban on using plastic packaging for fruit and veg.
attributes.background: Bring back paper bags and cardboard containers for fruit and vegetables. The amount of plastic waste generated annually in the UK is estimated to be nearly 3 million tonnes. An estimated 56% of all plastics waste is used packaging, three-quarters of which is from households. Free the cucumber!

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL.
attributes.background: Communication  in children is very important. But what happens when the only way to communicate is by sign? Not being able to communicate and make friends can lower a child's self-esteem.Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL in schools.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to walk a dog in a public place without a lead on
attributes.background: I am seeing a lot of dog attacks lately that could have been avoided if the dog was on a lead. I think it should be the law that all dogs are on a lead in a public place

attributes.action: Debate whether self-regulation of the press is adequate.
attributes.background: The UK press is constantly coming under fire for misrepresenting stories and misleading the public with inflammatory opinion pieces that purport to be news items.
attributes.additional_details:
“the press is given significant and special rights in this country ... With these rights, however, come responsibilities to the public interest: to respect the truth, to obey the law and to uphold the rights and liberties of individuals. In short, to honour the very principles proclaimed and articulated by the industry itself (and to a large degree reflected in the Editors’ Code of Practice)”.
- Sir Brian Leveson

Some newspapers are clearly failing to 'respect the truth'.

attributes.action: Scrap fees for renunciation of all types of British nationalities.
attributes.background: British nationals who want to retain EU citizenship, because they live abroad or have direct links with other EU states, some will be forced to give up their British citizenship as some EU countries don't allow dual nationality. This is a hurtful decision and the UK must not take money away from us.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/fees-for-citizenship-applications

attributes.action: Stop BT having the monopoly on installing phone lines so other providers can.
attributes.background: As consumers in this day and age we should be able to have options to use a company for a service or not. BT have not been able to provide myself and others on the estate with a phone line or internet services, myself since June 2016 others longer than 8 months
attributes.additional_details: some of the residents including myself on the estate have gone down the complaints route to the CEO and it's still not been resolved and no foreseeable dates for a resolution either. Only BT install phone lines then rent them to other providers. There is literally nothing any of us have been able to do. Every week we chase for an update to be told it's still being looked at. No dates no resolution and no phone line and Internet

attributes.action: Introduce LGBT relationship education, similar to heterosexual relationships.
attributes.background: If we introduce LGBT education from a young age, we are more likely to rid the country of the stigma that still affects young people, and causes bullying and harm throughout our society. Educating people will almost definitely reduce the ignorance that causes homophobia.

attributes.action: Give drink drivers an instant 4 week jail sentence if convicted to deter them.
attributes.background: In 2014 stats show that some 220 people were killed in crashes in which a driver was over the legal limit, 880 were seriously injured. Nearly 1 in 6 of all deaths on the road involve drivers who are over the legal alcohol limit. This is still too high and people still think it's OK to drink-drive.
attributes.additional_details: A total of 613,090 people were charged with drink driving during this period. 2004 - 2014. Statistics show that 595,093 (97%) of defendants charged were subsequently convicted while 17,997 (97%) were not convicted. Taken from drink driving.org

attributes.action: Review decision-making process behind closure of nightclubs in the UK.
attributes.background: Following Islington Council's decision last night (6th September) not to renew the license for Fabric, an iconic dance music venue in London, we request that parliament reviews why decisions like this one and others are consistently being made to the detriment of dance and youth music culture.
attributes.additional_details: Fabric holds global significance for dance music, launching the careers of many artists and drawing crowds from all over world. In the last three months several other venues including The Arches, Passing Clouds and Dance Tunnel have also been forced to close. Dance music is an important part of music culture; the closure of places that grow the community, foster innovation and provide a venue to enjoy this music, will lead to the loss of the UK’s status of a breeding ground for musical talent.

attributes.action: Support Peoples QE. Reduce private debts, boost savings, rescue the economy.
attributes.background: Public and Private Debts are at an all time high in the United Kingdom.  net unsecured borrowing on credit cards and loans will rise to £662bn by the end of the decade, from £447bn in 2016. The amount of private debt is crippling the economy. We need to reduce debt in the economy.
attributes.additional_details: I am proposing that we reduce private debt through Bond given to all UK Citizens. The bond would be financed throuh QE  money created by the Bank of England. This financial value of the bond ( sat £1000 per person) would be used to either clear existing debts ( as specified) or as a savings bond for people without debt. The policy would reduce debt, increase savings, compensate savers for low interest rates reduce poverty, and help the economy to grow.

attributes.action: GAIN 'CONSUMER RIGHTS' REGARDING 'OVER PHONE' CONTRACTS FOR SMALL BUSINESSES.
attributes.background: l purchased a small pub 2 years ago to save from closure. When agreeing a Sports package over the phone I realised the next day this was not what I required. After immediate calls, letter and emails I was told I have no 14 day cooling off period, I could not cancel, and had to pay for a full year.
attributes.additional_details: Small businesses do not have the infrastructure of large companies and cannot have resources to cover all areas for contracts, accountancy, and legal complications. Specifically regarding contracts agreed over the phone where the seller could not possibly deliver all the rules and regulations of a contract, there should be 14 days allowed to consider an agreement in full. Presently an 'over the phone agreement' is irreversible and binding. Equivalence of consumer rights for Small Businesses.

attributes.action: Improve CAMHS services in Cumbria, especially surrounding eating disorders.
attributes.background: There is a huge lack of resources and staff within Cumbria CAMHS, having just one dietitician in the entire county. The team regularly allows patients suffering from eating disorders to get so severe they require inpatient treatment hundreds of miles away.There are no specialists and a lack of care.
attributes.additional_details:
CAMHS stands for Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services, and this is where children and teenagers up to the age of 18 get support and therapy for their mental illnesses. 
There are NO specialist eating disorder services within the whole county; the closest being Middlesborough, which I am currently staying as an inpatient with severe Anorexia Nervosa for the second time due to the immense lack of support and understanding in Cumbria. This is a 2 and a half hour journey. 
This is not fair.

attributes.action: more support for parents with mental health, stop removing children
attributes.background: I have borderline personality disorder and because of a relapse and time in hospital, I had my children removed and placed in care. This was meant to be until I got better but they are still not home despite a return to good health and the children begging to be back. I am now fighting for them
attributes.additional_details: Too many children are removed based on a parent having mental health problems. I had mine taken despite social services saying I was a good mum and commending me on my parenting. All assessments have been positive but the psychological report paints a bad picture of people with mental health. How is removing children unless they were physically or sexually abused, benefitting children and their parents? More support in the home is needed for those that can be a good parent with help.

attributes.action: Government to condemn the USA police forces for killing innocent Black citizens
attributes.background: Statistics show that on average around 30 African American citizens in America are killed by law enforcement officers each month.  This is unacceptable in a civilized society.  The UK is America's closest alley and so should be able to speak up and ask that America takes measures to stop this issue.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_killings_by_law_enforcement_officers_in_the_United_States

attributes.action: Fair and regulated pricing for EV charging points within the UK.
attributes.background: Ecotricity today 7th July 2016 increased the price of EV charging from free to £5 per a 20 minute charge. They apparently consulted EV drivers and consider this to be a fair price. The new pricing makes long distance travel not economically viable with an EV.

attributes.action: Set up Brexit commission to advise on implications before Article 50 invoked
attributes.background: In the referendum campaign voters asked for the facts but with no historic precedent this left politicians free to say anything to secure votes.  The implications are now much clearer with some known facts to draw on. An independent commission will provide impartial advice before invoking Article 50

attributes.action: All NHS employers to pay staff at least the living wage.
attributes.background: Some of the lowest paid NHS staff are working below the living wage. Please sign and support this petition

attributes.action: Don't rush Brexit: invoke Article 50 after the next general election in 2020.
attributes.background:
The government carried out it's promise to have a referendum; it was not elected to exit the European Union. 

Exiting the European Union is a massive undertaking, and requires planning, strong leadership and clear vision.

For the Brexit to succeed, we need a government elected for the purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
Points to consider from the Conservative Manifesto:
"Our commitment to you:
keep our economy secure by running a surplus so that we start paying down our debts."
"We will use our membership of ...the
EU [amongst other organisations]...to achieve the best for Britain."
"We want an EU that helps Britain move ahead..."
"The Conservative Party is the party of the Union
– and we will always do our utmost to keep our family
of nations together."

attributes.action: Refrain from triggering Article 50 until trade deals negotiated.
attributes.background: if Britain triggers Article 50 before the Government has successfully negotiated the terms of any trade treaties with the EU and all other major economies of the world it is likely to back us into a corner from which there is no return.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst Europe will want to trade with us it is not going to do so at the risk of further destabilising the EU. Trade figures clearly demonstrate that we need EU trade more than it needs ours. We will be negotiating with an EU that will have little sympathy for our position and every reason to make an example of us in order to prevent other EU member states contemplating a similar move. To invoke Article 50 before establishing the trading terms could well be political suicide.

attributes.action: Delay David Cameron invoking Article 50 to provide more time for EU discussions
attributes.background: 14,400,000 British people voted to REMAIN in the EU. These people cannot be ignored and by delaying David Cameron's invoking of Article 50 this would give the UK time to have more discussion with the EU and possibly come to a mutually beneficial agreement, such as Norway enjoy.
attributes.additional_details:
Voting figures taken from the BBC 2016 - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36615028

Information regarding Article 50 taken from The Guardian, 2016 - http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/23/eu-referendum-legally-binding-brexit-lisbon-cameron-sovereign-parliament

attributes.action: more funding for paediatric cardiac teaching more complex /rare heart conditions
attributes.background: My daughter aged 6months died in hospital due to post op complications. She had ebsteins anomaly a rare heart condition.  Doctors in the UK don't know much about this condition and struggle to help fix/ and or treat accordingly.

attributes.action: Do not allow the sale of our utilities to foreign companies
attributes.background: A Chinese consortium are trying to purchase a majority stake in National Grid's £11billion gas distribution network. The Prime Minister promised tighter regulations on foreign investments in the UK, it seems to be an empty promise. Our utilities need to stay under British control. Sign if you agree.

attributes.action: Stop paying non uk citizens any benifits
attributes.background: If we stop paying benifits. Some migrants will leave of there own accord. Some might stop trying to come to the UK

attributes.action: Guarantee rights of UK Nationals resident in other EU states will not change.
attributes.background: As a matter of urgency we call upon the UK government to unambiguously commit to guarantee any ‘Brexit deal’ will ensure all rights currently enjoyed by UK nationals resident in other EU states prior to the triggering of article 50 will remain unchanged.
attributes.additional_details: According to UN estimates 1.2 million UK Citizens have exercised their right as EU citizens to move permanently to other EU states. In many cases, if not most, entire lives are now in adoptive countries. Businesses have been opened, property has been purchased, children have been enrolled in local schools. Many such individuals were denied a voice in the Brexit vote due residency status abroad and / or errors of the electoral committee.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for mental health especially in the young
attributes.background: Mental health services have been suffering with cuts year after year, until we are now ultimately in a 'mental health crisis', so many people are suffering and nothing is being done. Our government promised us more funding and we are yet to see the action. Mental health can affect everyone.

attributes.action: Strengthen Laws against Negligent Private Surgeons & Healthcare Providers
attributes.background:
Private healthcare patients are commonly led to believe that the care they are paying for will meet the highest standards. 
In cases where patients receive wrongful or negligent treatment  private healthcare patients have less access to adequate redress and compensation than NHS patients.
attributes.additional_details:
At present legislation is so insufficient that one private healthcare company actually stated in a legal defence document that they were ‘under no obligation to provide competent surgeons to perform surgery at the hospital’ and had ‘no duty to protect patients from harm, and risk of injury’.

We ask Secretary of State for Health, Jeremy Hunt  to close the legal loophole which allows for private healthcare patients to be left without protection or redress when things go wrong.

attributes.action: Make UK pet stores ban all pet products made in China
attributes.background: There are cases every single day of dogs and cats dying horrific deaths due to the chemicals and processes used to produce pet products in China. Their relentless disregard for pet health makes them unfit to produce these products and it's time the UK pet stores ban all China-made products.

attributes.action: Call on Theresa May to scrap Hinckley C
attributes.background:
Call on Theresa May to scrap Hinkley C

I have no in principle objection to nuclear power. Neither do I wish to comment on cost, no-one on the planet knows whether the strike price will be good bad or indifferent in 10, 20 or 30 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Firstly we do not know if it will work! There is no working version to base a decision on. What if in 8 years we find it doesn't? We will have a serious problem.

Second, EDF will come under huge pressure to make it work and make it work by 2025, what short cuts might they be tempted to perform as a consequence?

Finally, the world political scene is unclear for the next 5 years let alone 30+ years, we simply should not put the energy production for our country in the hands of other countries.

attributes.action: Please start funding pet cemeteries like other country's.
attributes.background: I think we can all agree that our pets are more than just pets, they become best friends and family members. it is only because of my dog that I can leave my house due to my mental health. He is my bet friend and I think others will agree we need a place to rest them just like we do with people.
attributes.additional_details: As a lot of us see them as more than pets, we should have places where we can bury them and let them rest in piece. They are loved ones and should be treated as such. They don't ask for a lot in life, all they ask for is love and care and don't we all just want love? If you look after your animal, they will look after you. Please consider this as I can assure you, many, many people will really appreciate being able to use these places. Thank you.

attributes.action: Repeal tail docking ban for KC working breeds at the very least The Dobermann
attributes.background: In 2007 the government banned the docking of tails, but allowed some working breeds to continue to be docked, 9yrs down the line and the amount of damaged tails is causing immeasurable suffering Please think carefully and help to end the suffering of these dogs.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence will be updated daily here from July 26th 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/1753160231634236/
Repeal the ban or at the very least allow all breeds classified as Working Group dogs have their tails docked by a vet. Older dogs having tails amputated is not acceptable.The Doberman has been 
traditionally docked from its creation, now with tails we have 
varying degrees of length carriage and thickness this is causing unnecessary suffering. Allow docking by a vet within 3 days of birth.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wages for 17-20 year olds.
attributes.background: National minimum wage for 17-20 year old's should be increased, wages they receive are not just. Being a 20 year old earning £5.50 p/h is inadequate, knowing how much effort and sacrifice you put into working alongside studying. Yet we are liable for paying adult fares on public transport.

attributes.action: Stop all DWP benefit payment sanctions immediately.
attributes.background:
It is basically unethical and unhealthy.
The UN agree - It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in B
attributes.additional_details:
THE United Nations committee on economic and cultural rights recently published a highly damning report.
It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in Britain.
The report considers a number of areas, all of which are drastically important to our everyday lives. . . . 
 foodbanks, unemployment rates, the housing crisis, mental health care and discrimination against migrants and disabled people.

attributes.action: Review and Change the Assesment process for PIP & ESA
attributes.background: Due to the unprecedented amount of Personal Independent Payment (PIP) and Employment Support Allowance (ESA) claims that are being overturned at Mandatory Reconsideration (MR) and Tribunal, we  demand that the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP), review and change the assessment system.
attributes.additional_details:
1.To stop using Atos/Capita assessors
2.All initial assessments to be carried out by the claimants local GP 
3.ALL assessors to be medically competent with the conditions they are assessing
4.ALL assessment’s to be recorded as a matter of course
6.Copies of all assessment reports to be sent to claimants 
7.Assessors to be penalised if reports untruthful
8.If a claimant goes through the process and awarded by the Court of Tribunal. The DWP should not withhold payment because of appeal.

attributes.action: The government is to declassify all plans on TTIP & make plans available online
attributes.background: Such a large trade deal should be available for all the public to read and scrutinise, why is it that we are having to request this information into the public eye. We want this information to be accessible to all people, as we all know the consequences of deals made outside the democratic arena.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transatlantic_Trade_and_Investment_Partnership

attributes.action: Impose a tuition fee cap for international students
attributes.background: The fees for Home/EU students are controlled by the UK Government; however, there isn't a cap for the international students. Institutions may charge international students up to 3 times the Home/EU fees. In addition, institutions may continue to raise the tuition fees. This should be capped.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to park a motor vehicle on a public footpath.
attributes.background: Vehicles obstructing the public footpath, are breaking the law, to enable a vehicle to park in such a way, the vehicle has driven to its position, driving on the footpath is illegal. Pedestrians on many occasions have to walk into traffic to pass these vehicles obstructing the footpath.
attributes.additional_details: Section 34(1) of the Road Traffic Act 1988 (RTA 1988) provides that anyone driving a mechanically propelled vehicle, for example a motor car, on a road that is a footpath, bridleway or restricted byway is guilty of an offence unless it can be shown that there is a private right in place for people to use the accessway to gain vehicular access to their property. The burden of proving that there is such a vehicular right of way in place rests with the defendant.

attributes.action: Make schools remove climbing frames due to the health and safety of the children
attributes.background: I believe that climbing frames are a risk to the health and safety of children when used in a school playground environment. They are at risk of serious injury should they fall or are pushed by another child.
attributes.additional_details:
My daughter had an accident at her local Nursery when playing on the climbing frame, she fell from the top bar and then hit another bar seriously injuring her before she hit the ground.
I feel that children in a school environment are at a higher risk of injury from playing on a climbing frame than if they were playing on one in a park with their parents there to supervise.

attributes.action: Invoke The Treaty of Windsor to protect Portuguese in the UK and vice versa
attributes.background: In the spirit of mutual assistance contained within the “Anglo Portuguese Alliance” and with recent post Brexit extremist goading non UK citizens to leave I propose UK give special protection and rights to Portuguese within the UK  and the same protection be afforded to UK citizens in Portugal.
attributes.additional_details:
The Treaty of Windsor has been invoked by the UK on a numbers of occasions to protect the UK including two world wars & the Falklands campaign 
Treaty text of the extant alliance guaranteeing assistance refers: "the ally shall be bound to give aid and succour to the other, so far as he is able (without any deceit, fraud, or pretence) to the extent required by the danger to his ally’s realms, lands, domains, and subjects; and he shall be firmly bound by these present alliances to do this”

attributes.action: Allow a second referendum on the subject of our membership of the European Union
attributes.background: We believe that the "In" or "Out" choice was too simplistic for a decision of such importance and that clear and unbiased information was not available. We believe that we should have been asked additionally, or instead, "Would you chose to remain within a substantially reformed European Union"?

attributes.action: Debate within 100 days the Government's costed plan for the UK to leave the EU
attributes.background: Good governance requires such a momentous change of national direction to be underpinned by a properly formulated plan with specific objectives, milestones for the change process and timescales for final delivery, detailed costings and an associated risk management plan.
attributes.additional_details: The people of the United Kingdom must be informed of the plan and its detail debated in Parliament within 100 days.

attributes.action: Bring back capital punishment for peodophiles and child sex offenders
attributes.background: Make the future safer for kids.

attributes.action: David Cameron should not invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty immediately
attributes.background: The UK has voted to Leave the EU. The vote is not legally binding and UK Parliament is sovereign. David Cameron does not have to invoke article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty, giving our intention to leave the EU immediately. He should use the Leave vote as a negotiating tool and then hold a 2nd referendum

attributes.action: Lower the Income Requirement for Spouse/Family Visas to UK from non EU Countries
attributes.background: The current income requirement for British citizens to bring their non-EU spouses to the UK is £18,600. According to the BBC, 50% of British Citizens do not earn enough to meet the new requirements. Britons earning minimum wage should have the right to a family. by basic human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
The High Courts suggested £13,000 ,above National Minimum Wage.Which, is being appealed by the Home Office as too low. Members of the EU with non-EU spouses aren't subjected to the same requirement. British citizens should not be punished for who they want to marry. 
The HS, Theresa May, said 'these current laws openly discriminate against the poor'.
Propose lowering the income requirement so that citizens working full-time(40 hours)on a minimum wage salary can be with their Spouses.

attributes.action: Introduce a social awareness lesson within the curriculum.
attributes.background: Bullying and discrimination within schools needs to be stopped. Let's introduce a social awareness lesson to allow youngsters the freedom of speech and allow them to talk about problems open and freely. Educate our youngsters the benefits of talking about problems and acceptance of other people.
attributes.additional_details: By educating youngsters about everyone is different and copes with things in different ways this will allow them to understand others behaviours and attitudes in situations. Mental health is vital within youngsters and allowing them to have a social skills lesson where they can talk about problems and understand that everyone battles life in different ways, and talk about their feelings and worries. Teaching our kids while still young will give them coping mechanisms to deal with different situations and teach them that bullying and discrimination is unacceptable and that not all illnesses/disabilities are visible.

attributes.action: Don't add the age verification and censoring of "non-conventional" on porn sites
attributes.background: Age verification checks on porn websites will be hard to implement. ISPs already offer many ways to do this without having to risk personal information. If age verification is done using credit card then dodgy websites may take advantage of this.
attributes.additional_details:
The government should not be allowed to decide what types of porn people are allowed to watch. As long as its consenting, over-18 adults, and it does not go against current law then it should be perfectly fine to show online.

Implementing age verification on to websites will be very risky if it uses personal information to check you are over-18. Lots of porn sites have been hacked recently so that is also a big concern. Parental controls can be easily setup so this is unneeded.

attributes.action: All HGVs and PCVs on british roads to have driver monitoring technology
attributes.background: Distraction such as mobile phone usage or 'micro sleeping' are major contributing factors to many deaths on British roads. Result can be much worse when in control of a HGV or PCV. Legislation to ensure that these class' of vehicle are fitted with the driver monitoring technology will save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-10-31/lorry-driver-who-killed-mother-and-three-children-while-on-mobile-phone-sentenced-for-10-years/

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/aug/04/lorry-driver-danny-warby-found-guilty-crash-death-sharon-garrett-cambridgeshire

http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/drivers/fatigue/road-accidents/

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/tiredness-can-kill-advice-for-drivers


http://www.brake.org.uk/wake-up/15-facts-a-resources/facts/485-driver-tiredness

attributes.action: End the 'Special Relationship' with the USA in the event of a Trump presidency.
attributes.background: After 580,000 petitioned to ban his entry into the UK, Trump may become president. Our Special Relationship means the British people may be dragged into economic, political and military conflict by a hated man. In this time of vulnerability, the UK must distance itself from Trump's America.
attributes.additional_details: In a campaign mired in racism, xenophobia, extremism, and sexual assault, Donald Trump has outlined plans which, due to the US/UK 'Special Relationship', may endanger British citizens and interests. This includes nuclear proliferation in Korea and Japan, the abandonment of NATO, forcing Mexico to pay for a border wall, ground troops in Syria, torture, opposition to China, and potential war with Iran and North Korea. If Trump wins, the UK must take a stand against his administration.
